alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Accomack and northern Northampton Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Willis Wharf to Exmore to 6 miles southeast of Nassawadox. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Locations impacted include... Exmore, Onancock, Parksley, Onley, Nassawadox, Willis Wharf, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis, Wachapreague, Painter, Hallwood, Keller, Harborton, Mappsville, Franktown, Wallops Island, Temperanceville and Nelsonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
